intro: Lindsaea meifolia, commonly known as the meadow lindsaea, is a species of epiphytic fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant has delicate, linear leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces small, clustered spore capsules on the underside of its fronds. Lindsaea meifolia is characterized by its intricate leaf structure and its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
